title: 11. IRRI Agronomy Challenge: Assessing Biotic Influences at Maximum Tillering (16 February 2012)

subtasks: Observing crop growth and filling gaps
Sampling for animal pests (insects, snails, rats)
Collecting data on injuries caused by animal pests
Assessing injuries caused by diseases (viral, bacterial, fungal)
Sampling weeds and recording their impact on canopy height
Using sweep net to count flying insects (e.g., green leaf hoppers)
Employing tapping method with pan and water to count sucking insects (e.g., plant hoppers)
Documenting overall biological impacts on the crop across different stages
Identifying rat-inflicted damage in the field
Assessing extent and selectivity of rat feeding
Evaluating the impact of rat activity on crop yield
Implementing rodent control measures as part of regular program
Monitoring and preventing the spread of new bare areas caused by rats
Observing overall crop growth and filling of gaps
Sampling for animal pests (insects, snails, rats)
Collecting data on injuries caused by animal pests
Assessing injuries caused by diseases (viral, bacterial, fungal)
Sampling weeds and recording their impact on canopy height
Using sweep net to collect flying insects
Employing tapping method with pan and water to collect insects
Identifying rat-damaged areas in the field
Assessing the extent and selectivity of rat feeding
Evaluating the impact on crop yield
Implementing rodent control measures
Monitoring and preventing new bare areas

Put MAINTASK: and list subtasks. Yeah, the initial instruction mentions "MAINTASK:" and to list each subtask under a numbered or bulleted list. Wait, actually, the instruction says MAINTASK followed directly by the general task, then lines of SUBTASK followed by the subtasks. So I need to write each subtask as a single line under MAINTASK, right?
